description: From nit +‎ pick, originally referring to literally removing invisibly tiny louse eggs by hand.

verbs.description: nitpick (third-person singular simple present nitpicks, present participle nitpicking, simple past and past participle nitpicked)

entries.meaning: (figurative) To correct insignificant mistakes or find fault in unimportant details.
examples: Someone will invariably nitpick about any spelling error posted to the forums.

entries.meaning: (archaic, literally) To pick nits (lice eggs) from someone’s hair. I nitpicked his hair.
